titleStmt.title: Letter from G. B. Shaw to William Burton
titleStmt.author: George Bernard Shaw
titleStmt.editor: Digital Scholarly Editing Team, London Rare Books School

publicationStmt.p: This is a born-digital diplomatic transcription of an unpublished letter.

sourceDesc.p: Written on one side of a card with Shaw's stock letterhead

address.addrLine:
[Written sideways in the left margin:] to Mr. William Burton
77 Queens Buildings
Collinson Street, London SE1

div.p: There is nothing in all this that your children will not be able to learn––if they want to––from books by more practiced hands.

I should have guessed you to be a young man with an itch for writing, in which case I should have recommended you to write a thousand words a day for five years to find out whether you could write professionally or not.
It takes as long to make a skilled writer as a skilled carpenter for a man of your turn of mind.
I have only just returned from the continent, where I have passed 2 months out of reach of your MS. manuscript
